Add `--diff` to check added lines only

This update adds a new workflow, now recommended:
check alex only in the CI (currently, Travis only),
with the new `-d, --diff` flag.  This *only* warns
for newly added warnings.

Update internals to not include stringification

Previously, both remark-stringify and retext-stringify were included
albeit not used.  This update removes the unneeded parts by not
depending on remark and retext directly.  This drops the size
down from 321kb to 261kb (minified), and 102kb to 85kb (GZIPed).

Update docs

Closes GH-94.
Closes GH-95.
Add mention of profanities in support section
Add Travis deployment to npm, GitHub Releases

Add support for `.alexrc`, `package.json` config

This feature adds support for configuration through `.alexrc` files,
and a `alex` field in `package.json` files.

To kick things off, an `allow` array can be specified in these
configurations, which holds a list of rules to be ignored when
detecting suggestions.

For example, the following can be used inside a `package.json` file to
not warn about `butt`:

```txt
{
  ...
  "alex": {
    "allow": ["butt"]
  },
  ...
}
```

...or, the following to not warn about `boogeyman` in an `.alexrc`
file:

```json
{
  "allow": ["boogeyman-boogeywoman"]
}
```

Closes GH-18.

Add support for detecting profanities

Previously, alex was only focussed on detecting phrasing which
might unconsciously be uttered without meaning to harm readers.

This update adds support for profanities and vulgar phrasing.

Closes GH-46.

Add support for inline warning control

This update adds support for per paragraph message silencing
(`ignore`), turning off messages (`disable`) and turning on messages
(`enable`) through HTML comment markers in markdown.

For example:

```md
<!--alex ignore dad-mom-->

A window will **not** pop up.
```

Yields:

```txt
readme.md: no issues found
```

Closes GH-16.

Update mdast to remark

This includes a much faster markdown parsing process, better sentence
detection, and much more.

Add support for file finding, ignoring

* Add support for finding markdown and text files when

* Add support for `.alexignore` files to exclude

Closes GH-49.
Closes GH-59.

Add support for not treating input as markdown

By adding a `.markdown()` method (same as `alex()`), and
`.text()`, it is now possible to *not* ignore code, HTML,
and other raw constructs which are ignored by HTML.

alex(1) receives a new `-t, --text` flag to enable this
behavior.
